info.name: Teamtailor API
info.description:
The Teamtailor API is following the [JSON API Specification](http://jsonapi.org/). If you have any question or feedback please contact us at [support@teamtailor.com](https://mailto:support@teamtailor.com) ## Example use cases: - Add/Import candidates and get detailed information about candidates - Build a custom career site. Display info about jobs, departments and locations. - List current job openings, get detailed information and create new jobs ### **URLs for EU or NA stack:** When calling Teamtailorâ€™s Public API the base URL will depend on the stack where your data is being stored. Request URLs: - For EU stack use [api.teamtailor.com](http://api.teamtailor.com/) - For NA stack, use [api.na.teamtailor.com](http://api.na.teamtailor.com/) --- # Authentication ``` http GET https://api.teamtailor.com/v1/jobs HTTP/1.1 Authorization: Token token=abc123abc123 ``` Authenticate your account when using the API by including your secret API key in the request. [Manage your API keys](https://app.teamtailor.com/app/settings/integrations/api-keys). Autentication is performed by passing the api key in the Authorization header. _You must replace_ `_abc123abc123_` _with your own API key._ --- ## Permissions Your api keys might have different scope and permissions. ### Public Has access to public data, basically all data that is publicly visible on your career site. #### `read` Can read all public data, for example jobs, departments, locations. #### `write` Can create new jobs. #### `read/write` Can do all above and update existing jobs. ### Internal Same as `Public`, but can also access internal, unlisted & archived jobs. #### `read` Can read all public & internal data, for example jobs, departments, locations. #### `write` Can create new jobs. #### `read/write` Can do all above and update existing jobs. ### Admin Has access to all resources. #### `read` Can read all data, for example candidates, jobs, users. #### `write` Can create new jobs, candidates and job applications. #### `read/write` Can do all above and update jobs, candidates and job applications. --- # Versioning ``` http GET https://api.teamtailor.com/v1/jobs?filter[department]=337 HTTP/1.1 X-Api-Version : {{api_version}} ``` When we make backwards-incompatible changes to the API, we release new, dated versions. You can use todays date as `X-Api-Version` to always get the latest version of the API. To set the API version on a specific request, send a `X-Api-Version` header. See the [API changelog](#changelog) to see current and old versions. _The_ `X-Api-Version` _header is required when making requests to the API_ Successful API requests will have the used API version in the response header `X-Api-Version` --- # Rate Limit You get a bucket of 50 requests every 10 second. When the number of requests reach the rate limit the api will respond with HTTP status code 429. > Headers ``` X-Rate-Limit-Limit # The number of allowed requests in the current period X-Rate-Limit-Remaining # The number of remaining requests in the current period X-Rate-Limit-Reset # The number of seconds left in the current period ``` --- # Pagination > Example response ``` json { "meta": { "record-count": 2, "page-count": 1 }, "links": { "prev": "https://api.teamtailor.com/v1/jobs?filter[department]=337&page[before]=NQ&page[size]=10&sort=id", "next": "https://api.teamtailor.com/v1/jobs?filter[department]=337&page[after]=Ng&page[size]=10&sort=id", } } ``` All top-level API resources have support for bulk fetches via "list" API methods. The **links key** in the response may contain any of the following links: - first: the first page of data - last: the last page of data - prev: the previous page of data - next: the next page of data The **meta key** contains: - record-count: The total number of items in the collection, - page-count: The number of pages The page size can be changed with the following parameter: - `page[size]`, the number of resources per page. Default: 10, max: 30. --- # Examples Here are some real world usage examples of the Teamtailor API. ## Paginate a list Get the first page of jobs, with 20 jobs per page. ``` http GET https://api.teamtailor.com/v1/jobs?page[size]=20 HTTP/1.1 Authorization: Token token=abc123abc123 X-Api-Version: {{api_version}} ``` ### Parameters used in this example | Parameter | Value | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | page\[size\] | 20 | Get 20 jobs in the list. | ## List published jobs with their department and locations Get a list of published jobs and include their departments and locations in one request. ``` http GET https://api.teamtailor.com/v1/jobs?include=department,locations HTTP/1.1 Authorization: Token token=abc123abc123 X-Api-Version: {{api_version}} ``` ### Parameters used in this example | Parameter | Value | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | include | department,locations | Comma separated list of relations to include in the response. | ## List latest hired candidates Get a list of the most recent hired candidates ``` http GET https://api.teamtailor.com/v1/job-applications?include=candidate&filter[stage-type]=hired&sort=-changed_stage_at HTTP/1.1 Authorization: Token token=abc123abc123 X-Api-Version: {{api_version}} ``` ### Parameters used in this example | Parameter | Value | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | include | candidate | Since we're fetching latest job applications, we must include the candidate if we wan't more data about each hire. | | filter\[stage-type\] | hired | Just list job applications marked as hired | | sort | \-changed_stage_at | Sort applications by most recent added to current (hired) stage | ## Create candidate with a To-Many location relationship Create a `candidates` resource with a `To-Many` relationship to a `locations` resource set. The `location` resource has to be created before this request is executed. ``` http POST https://api.teamtailor.com/v1/candidates HTTP/1.1 Authorization: Token token=abc123abc123 X-Api-Version: {{api_version}} {"data":{"type":"candidates","attributes":{"email":"jonas@example.com","pitch":"Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.","last-name":"Jonas","first-name":"Brusman","merge":true},"relationships":{"locations":{"data":[{"id":"1","type":"locations"}]}}}} ``` --- ## Embed application form ### Example iframe ``` html ``` --- ### Iframe helper script ``` html ``` To embed an application form on your website, create an iframe and set the `src` attribute to the job's `careersite-job-apply-iframe-url` attribute. Remember to set `frameborder="0"` and `style="width: 100%; height: 800px"`. To enable features such as auto-resize of the iframe, insert the helper script to the right in the `head` section of your page. ### Create a job from a template To create a job from a template you need first to obtain the template ID and then include it in the POST request ``` html POST https://api.teamtailor.com/v1/jobs HTTP/1.1 Authorization: Token token=abc123abc123 Content-Type: application/json { "data": { "type": "jobs", "attributes": { "title": "Account Manager", "pitch": "Become part of something great!", "body": "

hello

", "template-id": 3026014 }, "relationships": { "user": { "data": { "id": 1479857, "type": "users" } } } } } ``` This will copy everything from the template including triggers, application form, etc. Values used in the payload will overwrite the template, so in above example, body will be set to 'Hello' You can fetch list of templates using GET jobs?filter\[status\]=template If you need to fetch a specific template, you can add `&filter[template-name]=template_name` to the existing filter in the request. For example: `GET jobs?filter[status]=template&filter[template-name]=your_template_name` # Changelog #### 2025-07-15 - Added `is-draft` to [Requisitions](https://docs.teamtailor.com/#1e928d4e-a299-4211-902e-ff2472ec4bb1) #### 2025-07-09 - Added [Divisions](https://docs.teamtailor.com/#5c46f829-f1cb-446c-ae59-bdfcb40f1672) resources. - Added the `divisions` relations to [Candidate](https://docs.teamtailor.com/#2f779ec9-9bc7-44d6-ac38-a5ef5c81396d), [Jobs](https://docs.teamtailor.com/#afd29ca3-689f-49a2-ba5d-d67f4ac4f757) and [Departments](https://docs.teamtailor.com/#97830188-a759-44ad-89d4-6d9ee64bad8a). - Added filter by `division` in the [Jobs list](https://docs.teamtailor.com/#a0351972-8394-4646-95f0-56a4c4e3886d) and in the [Candidates list](https://docs.teamtailor.com/#759f6a0c-5b05-4d9c-b1c8-af80c5d9b620). #### 2025-04-03 - Added [Forms](https://docs.teamtailor.com/#62df92b7-3b98-447e-aba2-88ea51857872), [Form questions](https://docs.teamtailor.com/#4e8d9aaf-951e-41aa-af03-a30979fdf08c) and [Form answers](https://docs.teamtailor.com/#c4778d98-6661-4231-b857-672794fc1241) resources. - Added the [Onboardings](https://docs.teamtailor.com/#e207bdd5-8fd2-40a5-ac40-2abb20857310) resource, available for customers using the [Onboarding add-on feature](https://support.teamtailor.com/en/articles/10264836-start-the-onboarding-of-your-new-hires-in-teamtailor). - Added Onboardings and Form answers relationships to [Candidates](https://docs.teamtailor.com/#2f779ec9-9bc7-44d6-ac38-a5ef5c81396d). #### 2024-11-12 - Added `/authenticated-video-url` endpoint to [answers](https://docs.teamtailor.com/#bc7522c7-6c6f-4e49-b8e9-737669b4fd8f) to get the playable video URL for video answers. The URL is valid for 2 hours. #### 2024-09-30 - Added `jobs` relation to [teams](https://docs.teamtailor.com/#d6c677e8-7105-4bbf-9413-4be624294a6e). - Added `team-memberships` relation to [users](https://docs.teamtailor.com/#a594cdda-efeb-4b67-b2a2-1b72baecd786). #### 2024-09-05 - New Api version available `X-Api-Version: 20240904`. - BREAKING CHANGES: Notes listing now follows the JSON api data strucutre. Instead of the data being wrapped inside "notes" it's now in "data", as all our listings. It also allows paginating. #### 2024-07-02 - added `template-id` to [jobs](#afd29ca3-689f-49a2-ba5d-d67f4ac4f757). #### 2024-05-29 - Added `job` and `stage-type` filters to [stages](#f7d1f021-112b-4631-9283-906429f805b5). #### 2024-05-24 - Added match score to [job-applications](#3a64e9b5-c1d4-4894-8978-2015adf13ec2) (read-only). #### 2024-04-10 - Added new [nps-responses](#55639fbf-f69a-4981-b775-05522a00f5fb) resource (read-only). #### 2024-04-04 - New Api version available `X-Api-Version: 20240404`. - BREAKING CHANGES: The old `stage-type` attribute of [stages](#f7d1f021-112b-4631-9283-906429f805b5) is renamed to `legacy-stage-type-name` to facilitate a new relationship for `stage-types`. This is not backwards compatible. - New resource [stage-types](#04411254-2faa-4e70-9721-5e7a98db2f94) can be used to list all stages/job-applications/candidates for a type of stage. - Added `stage-type` as relationship to [stages](#f7d1f021-112b-4631-9283-906429f805b5). #### 2023-08-24 - Added `consent-future-jobs-at` and `consent-given-future-jobs` to [candidates](#2f779ec9-9bc7-44d6-ac38-a5ef5c81396d) #### 2021-08-06 - Add `tags` filter to [job](#afd29ca3-689f-49a2-ba5d-d67f4ac4f757) - Add `custom-fields` filter to [custom-field-options](#custom-field-options) - Add `custom-fields` relationship to [job](#afd29ca3-689f-49a2-ba5d-d67f4ac4f757) #### 2021-05-05 - Added `updated-at` attribute to [job](#afd29ca3-689f-49a2-ba5d-d67f4ac4f757) #### 2021-02-18 - New Api version available `X-Api-Version: 20210218`. - BREAKING CHANGES: Changes related to user and notification settings api are no longer compatible with `X-Api-Version: 20161108`. - Added changes to [users](#users) resource. - Added new [notification-settings](#notification-settings) resource. #### 2020-11-30 - Added read-only `original-resume` field to [candidates](#candidates) to get the original file before converted to PDF. #### 2020-10-29 - Updated documentation for [Custom Fields](#custom-fields). - Added new [custom-field-selects](#custom-field-selects) resource. - Added new [custom-field-options](#custom-field-options) resource. #### 2020-10-06 - Added `remote-status` attribute to [job](#afd29ca3-689f-49a2-ba5d-d67f4ac4f757). #### 2020-10-01 _Bug fix_ - Removed the [activities](#activities) list endpoint (since it didn't work anyway). - Added `activities` relationships to the [users](#users), [candidates](#candidates), and [jobs](#afd29ca3-689f-49a2-ba5d-d67f4ac4f757) resources. - To list activities, please use any of these relationships. #### 2020-07-20 - Added new [notes](#notes) resource. - Added new [regions](#regions) resource. - Added `regions` relationship and filter to [candidate](#candidates) and [job](#afd29ca3-689f-49a2-ba5d-d67f4ac4f757). #### 2020-05-14 - Added `job` relationship and filter to [upload](#uploads). #### 2020-05-13 - Added `external-id` attribute to [user](#users). #### 2020-05-12 - Added new [team](#teams) resource. - Added `update`, `create`, and `delete` actions to the [role](#roles) resource. - Added `teams` relationship to [department](#departments) __and [role](#roles). #### 2020-04-23 - Added `job` relationship to [partner-result](#partner-results). - Added `partner-results` relationship to [candidate](#candidates). #### 2020-02-26 - Added `api-name` field to [custom-field](#custom-fields). #### 2019-11-14 - Added `signature` field to [user](#users). #### 2019-11-14 - Added the [requisitions](#requisitions) resource. - Added the [requisition-step-verdicts](#requisition-step-verdicts) resource. #### 2019-09-10 - Added the [custom-fields](#custom-fields) resource. - Added the [custom-field-values](#custom-field-values) resource. #### 2019-08-09 - Added the [referrals](#referrals) resource. #### 2019-08-08 - Added the [partner-results](#partner-results) resource. #### 2019-08-07 - Added the [activities](#activities) resource. #### 2019-07-31 - Added the [todos](#todos) resource. #### 2019-07-15 - Added `row-order` field to [stages](#stages). #### 2019-07-11 - Added `mailbox` field to [jobs](#afd29ca3-689f-49a2-ba5d-d67f4ac4f757). #### 2019-07-03 - Added `referred` field to [candidates](#candidates). #### 2019-06-18 - Added `login-email` field to [users](#users). #### 2019-05-17 - Added `locations` _resource to_ [jobs](#afd29ca3-689f-49a2-ba5d-d67f4ac4f757)_._ `_location_` _resource is now deprecated and will be removed after 2019.08.01_. #### 2019-05-06 - Added the [trigger](#triggers) resource. #### 2019-04-23 - Added `show` and `list` actions to the [stages](#stages) resource. - Added `active-job-applications-count` and `rejected-job-applications-count` attributes to [stages](#stages). #### 2019-04-23 - Added the [company](#companies) resource. #### 2019-04-15 - Added `pitch` attribute to [jobs](#afd29ca3-689f-49a2-ba5d-d67f4ac4f757). #### 2019-03-07 - Added `scheduled` status filter to [jobs](#afd29ca3-689f-49a2-ba5d-d67f4ac4f757) for internal/admin keys. #### 2019-03-07 - Added `jobs` relation to [users](#users) (the jobs user is recruiter for). #### 2019-01-09 - Added `set-consent-expiration` to [candidates](#candidates) to set consent expiration period for candidates who gave their permission for you to store their personal details. #### 2018-11-05 - Signed URLs to [Uploads](#uploads) files are valid for 1 minute. #### 2018-09-17 - Filter [Jobs](#afd29ca3-689f-49a2-ba5d-d67f4ac4f757) by status `archived`. #### 2018-07-17 - Added `created-at` field to `jobs` #### 2018-05-31 - Added `send-default-reply` attribute to [job-applications](#job-applications) #### 2018-05-11 - [Picked questions](#picked-questions) _endpoint._ - Added `picked-questions` resource to [jobs](#afd29ca3-689f-49a2-ba5d-d67f4ac4f757) - Added `name_requirement`, `resume_requirement`, `cover_letter_requirement`, `phone_requirement` attributes to [jobs](#afd29ca3-689f-49a2-ba5d-d67f4ac4f757) #### 2018-05-22 - New [User](#users) attributes for GDPR/data retention notifications. (`notification-removal-request` and `notification-gdpr-digest`) #### 2018-04-26 - [List questions](#list-questions) _endpoint._ #### 2018-04-19 - Add user notification settings attributes to the user object. - Add TeamMembership object to enable index, view, create and destroy actions on hiring team members. #### 2018-04-05 - Add `colleagues` relation to `jobs` (lists `users` related to the job ad). #### 2018-04-04 - Add `external-application-url` field to `jobs`. #### 2018-03-02 - Filter [candidates](#candidates) by `locations`. #### 2018-02-13 - New resource [Uploads](#uploads). - Added `uploads` resource to [candidates](#candidates). - Filter [candidates](#candidates) by `connected`, `department` and `role`. #### 2018-01-25 - Added `locations` resource to [candidates](#candidates). - Filter [users](#users) by `email`. - Can update `email` attribute on [users](#users). #### 2018-01-16 - Added `create` and `update` actions to [users](#users). #### 2017-10-31 - Added `tags` to [jobs](#afd29ca3-689f-49a2-ba5d-d67f4ac4f757). #### 2017-09-06 - Added `apply-button-text` attribute to [jobs](#afd29ca3-689f-49a2-ba5d-d67f4ac4f757). #### 2017-03-15 - Added `single-line` attribute to [questions](#questions). #### 2017-03-10 - Added `changed_stage_at` to [job applications](#job-applications). - Made it possible to filter on `stage-type` when listing [job applications](#job-applications). #### 2017-02-23 - New resources - [Answers](#answers) - [Candidates](#candidates) - [Job Applications](#job-applications) - [Questions](#questions) - [Stages](#stages)_._____ - New scopes [Admin](#authentication) and [Internal](#authentication). - [Embed job appliction form as an iframe](#embed-application-form)_._ #### 2016-11-08 New version - _First public version._

item.name: Answers

request.description:
Use this endpoint to retrieve lists of answers.

### Example parameters

Parameter      | Default   | Description
-------------- | --------- | -----------
include        | null      | Comma separated list of relations to include in the response. For example `candidate,question`.

response.name: List answers

request.description: Use this endpoint to retrieve a single answer.

Create a new Answer.
The relations question and candidate are required to be able to create a new answer.
If the candidate already has answered the question, the answer will be updated.
It is not possible to create file or video answer via API.

GET request to retrieve the authenticated video URL for a specific video answer.

### Request Parameters

- `answer_id` (path) : The ID of the answer. (Must be a video answer)
    

### Response

JSON object with `authenticated-video-url` and `usage-expiration-time` keys.

item.description: ### Required scope Admin ### Attributes Attribute | Type | Description ------------|---------|------------ boolean | boolean | choices | array | updated-at | date | range | integer | text | string | video-token | string | ### Relations The answer object always has a relation to a question and a candidate Relation | Description ----------|------------ question | candidate |

Use this endpoint to retrieve lists of audit events.

item.description:
### Required scope Admin ### Attributes Attribute | Type | Description --------------------|---------|------------ action | string | Action performed actor-id | integer | Actor id actor-label | string | Actor name actor-type | string | Actor type description | string | Description of the action ip-address | string | IP where the event was triggered from source-id | integer | Source id source-label | string | Depends on `source-type`.

item.name: Candidates

request.description:
## List Candidates

### Example parameters

| Parameter | Default | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| include | null | Comma separated list of relations to include in the response. For example `job-applications,department`. |
| filter\[email\] | null | Filter by email address. |
| filter\[division\] | null | Filter by division. |
| filter\[department\] | null | Filter by department. |
| filter\[role\] | null | Filter by role. |
| filter\[locations\] | null | Filter by locations. |
| filter\[regions\] | null | Filter by regions. |
| filter\[created-at\]\[from\] | null | Filter by created-at newer than this date. |
| filter\[created-at\]\[to\] | null | Filter by created-at older than this date. |
| filter\[updated-at\]\[from\] | null | Filter by updated-at newer than this date. |
| filter\[updated-at\]\[to\] | null | Filter by updated-at older than this date. |
| filter\[connected\] | null | _true_ or _false_ Filter candidates who has connected. |
| filter\[phone\] | null | Filter by phone (6-14) characters, can include `+`. |
| sort | id | Sort list by any of the candidate attributes. Use `-id` to sort by id descending. |

response.name: List candidates

request.description:
## Show a Candidate

Retrieve a specific candidate.

Parameter | Description
--------- | -----------
id        | The candidate's id.

response.name: Show candidate

request.description: ## Create candidate A unique email is a required attribute unless sourced is set to true. Use the merge attribute to merge the candidate attributes in case a candidate with a matching email address already exists. To upload a resume, send a publicly available URL in the resume attribute. Teamtailor will download the file and host it after creating the candidate.

response.name: Create candidate

request.description:
## Update candidate


Change a candidates attributes/relationships.

response.name: Update candidate

item.description:
# Candidates Required scope: Admin A candidate is defined by a unqiue email adress. If a candidate don't have any `job-applications` it can be either `sourced` or `connected`. - When `sourced` the candidate was added to the system by a recruiter. - When `referred` the candidate was added to the system by an employee. - When `connected` the candidate has opted in to recieve new job notifications and has also the option to create a richer and more personal profile. ### Attributes | Attribute | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | connected | boolean | | | consent-future-jobs-at | date | **Read only**, the date candidate gave consent for contacting about future jobs. | | consent-given-future-jobs | boolean | **Write only**, True if candidate gave consent for contacting about future jobs. | | created-at | date | | | updated-at | date | | | email | string | Email to candidate. Always unique. | | facebook-id | string | User id if connected with Facebook | | facebook-profile | string | **Read only**, html version of Facebook profile | | first-name | string | | | internal | boolean | | | last-name | string | | | linkedin-profile | string | **Read only**, html version of LinkedIn profile | | linkedin-uid | string | User id if connected with LinkedIn | | linkedin-url | string | URL to LinkedIn profile | | merge | boolean | **Write only** True if the attributes should be merged with an existing candidate, matched by email address.

To merge with a `sourced` candidate, the undocumented attribute `sourced_at` needs to be in the payload. | | original-resume | string | **Read only** Signed URL to original version of resume, valid for 30 seconds. | | phone | string | | | picture | string | Url to candidate picture | | pitch | string | 140 character pitch | | referring-site | string | **Read only**, friendly name parsed from referring-url (i.e. Facebook, Indeed etc) | | referring-url | string | | | referred | boolean | **Read only** True if added by an employee. | | resume | string | Signed URL to pdf-version of resume, valid for 30 seconds. When creating a candidate, this should be a publicly available URL to a document. | | sourced | boolean | True if added by a recruiter without applying | | set-consent-expiration | boolean | **Write only** True if candidate have given their consent for you to store their personal details. Will set an expiration period according to [your data retention settings](https://teamtailor.com/app/settings/gdpr). | | tags | array | | | unsubscribed | boolean | If true no new job notifications are sent | | send-welcome-message | boolean | **Create only**, set to true if you want to send the "Welcome to connect" email to the candidate. Default: false | ### Relations | Relation | Description | | --- | --- | | activities | Activity log | | division | | | department | | | role | | | job-applications | | | questions | | | answers | | | locations | | | regions | | | uploads | | | custom-field-values | | | partner-results | | | form-answers | | | onboardings | |

name                                    | string  | Company name

## Update custom field value

item.description: # Custom field value A custom field value represents the relationship between custom field and an owner (a candidate or a job). There are a number of custom field types as specified by the field-type attribute. * __CustomField::Text__ any kind of text * __CustomField::Email__ valid email address e.g `example@example.com` * __CustomField::Url__ valid url e.g `https://google.com` * __CustomField::Phone__ A phone number, can include any values, eg `+46 723 3223 123` * __CustomField::Date__ Date in ISO 8601 format e.g `2019-08-28` * __CustomField::Checkbox__ `true` or `false` * __CustomField::Number__ any number * __CustomField::Select__ id for selected __CustomFieldOption__ * __CustomField::MultiSelect__ array of ids for selected __CustomFieldOption__ ### Attributes Attribute | Type | Description ----------------|---------|------------ value | string | Mandatory. Depending on the type, format may change. Check the available types above field-type | string | Read only. Tells of which type the custom-field-value is. ### Relations Relation | Description ---------------|------------ custom_field | Mandatory. The custom field related to this resource. owner | Mandatory. Owner of the polymorphic relation. The two available owner types are "candidate" and "job".

Name of the custom field. api-name | string | A lowercase, sanitized version of the name. Useful to use in combination with the [Webhook Partner API](https://partner.teamtailor.com). item.description:
###### Read only resource

Forms consists of a collection of form-questions and form-answers. There are many types of forms in Teamtailor, so they can hold different kinds of information. Be sure to filter forms by `type` if you are looking for a certain type of form.

### Anonymous surveys

Anonymous surveys (having `open: false`) will return form-answers without candidate information, and form-questions with less than 10 answers will not return any form-answers.

#### Attributes

| **Attribute** | **Type** | **Description** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| name | string | The form title. |
| form-type | string ("Survey", "OnboardingForm", "JobOfferForm", "JobOfferTemplate", "ReferenceTemplate", "ReferenceForm") | The type of form, supported values listed in the type column. |
| intro-text | string | Text displayed before answering the form. |
| outro-title | string | Headline displayed after answering the form. |
| outro-text | string | Text displayed after answering the form. |
| options | object | Custom options for email subject/body. |
| open | boolean | `true` or `false` if the form answers are anonymous or not. |
| created-at | date |  |
| updated-at | date |  |

#### Relationships

| **Relation** | **Description** |
| --- | --- |
| form-questions | The questions for the form. |
| form-answers | The answers to the form-questions. |
| candidates | The candidates invited to answer the form. |

item.description:
This object represents the job ad and the job process in Teamtailor. You can retrieve a list or just a single job, update and create new jobs.

### Attributes

| Attribute | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| title | string | The title of the job ad |
| internal-name | string | The job internal name |
| pitch | string | The pitch of the job ad, displayed below the title |
| body | string | The ad text, simple html is supported |
| apply-button-text | string | Custom text for apply button |
| created-at | date | When job was first created. **Requires admin permission.** |
| updated-at | date | When job was last updated. |
| end-date | date | The Job ad's expire date |
| human-status | string | Human readable status of the job, can be one of the following: `archived`, `unlisted`, `expired`, `draft`, `published`, `scheduled` or `unsaved` |
| internal | boolean | True if internal job |
| picture | object | Job ad's picture |
| pinned | boolean | `true` if the job is pinned to the top on the career site |
| start-date | date | Scheduled date to publish the job ad |
| status | string | The job's status, can be one of the following: `open`, `draft,` `archived`, `unlisted` or `temp` |
| tags | array | Array of string for each tag **Requires admin permission.** |
| external-application-url | string | Optional attribute for where candidates should be linked when applying for the job. |
| name-requirement | string | Allowed options: `off`, `optional`, `required` |
| resume_requirement | string | Allowed options: `off`, `optional`, `required` |
| cover-letter-requirement | string | Allowed options: `off`, `optional`, `required` |
| phone-requirement | string | Allowed options: `off`, `optional`, `required` |
| mailbox | string | Job email **Read only. Requires admin permission.** |
| remote-status | string | The remote status of the job. Can be one of the following: `none`, `temporary`, `hybrid` or `fully` |
| currency | string | Ex. `SEK` |
| salary-time-unit | string | Allowed options: `monthly,` `hourly`, `yearly` , `daily` |
| min-salary | integer | Regular salary or min when range |
| max-salary | integer | Pass this value to enable range salary option |
| employment-type | string | Allowed options: `none`, `fully`, `part`, `contract`, `temporary`, `apprenticeship`, `internship`, `volunteer` |
| employment-level | string | Allowed options: `none`, `senior`, `mid`, `professionals`, `technicians`, `sales`, `administrative`, `support`, `craft`, `operatives`, `laborers`, `service` |
| language-code | string | ex 'ex' |
| template-id | integer | optionally create from template |

### Links

| Link | Description |
| --- | --- |
| careersite-job-url | View job on the Career site |
| careersite-job-internal-url | Secret link that will mark applications as internal |
| careersite-job-apply-url | URL to the application form |
| careersite-job-apply-iframe-url | URL for application iframe `src` |

### Relations

| Relation | Description |
| --- | --- |
| activities | Activity log |
| user | The recruiter |
| division | The division of the job |
| department | The department of the job |
| role | The role of the job |
| locations | Where the job is located |
| questions | The job's questions |
| picked-questions | Relation between job and question |
| candidates | Candidates who have applied to the job |
| stages | The recruitment stages of the job |
| team-memberships | The hiring team memberships |
| colleagues | The `users` that are displayed as colleagues of the job ad |
| regions | Regions based on where the job is located |
| custom-fields | The job's custom fields |
| custom-field-values | The job's custom field values |

item.description: _This resource is only available when using the_ [Onboarding add-on feature](https://support.teamtailor.com/en/articles/10264836-start-the-onboarding-of-your-new-hires-in-teamtailor)_._ This object represents the onboarding progress of a hired candidate. It has a status and progress percentage. When an onboarding is started, the candidate will receive forms to fill out according to the templates set up in Teamtailor. Get all the form answers including the questions for an onboarding by including these relations using a request like `/?include=form-answers.form-question`. #### Attributes | **Attribute** | **Type** | **Description** | | --- | --- | --- | | progress | number (0-100) | **Read only** Percentage of completed onboarding steps | | start-date | date | The new employee start date | | status | string ("active", "completed", "archived") | Status of the onboarding | | welcome-message | string | The welcome message sent as email to the employee | | work-email | string (email) | The new employee work email | | created-at | date | When the onboarding was created | | updated-at | date | When the onboarding was last updated | #### Relationships | Relation | Description | | --- | --- | | candidate | The candidate being onboarded | | user | The primary contact or manager | | department | Department of new employee | | role | Role of new employee | | location | Location of new employee | | job-application | Job application object of new employee | | forms | Forms sent to new employee to fill out | | form-questions | Form questions from the forms that were sent | | form-answers | Answers to the form questions that were sent | Filters

item.description: # Questions There are 5 types of question as specified by the question-type attribute. * __Boolean__ - true or false * __Choice__ - array of alternatives. If multiple is true multiple answers are allowed. Otherwise only one. * __Range__ - answer could be a number within the range defined by start-with and end-with. The unit contains the range unit (i.e year or pieces). * __Video__ - answer with a video * __Text__ - free text answers. If single-line is true input will be an input field with type text. Otherwise it will be a text area. * __File__ - It will return return public url to file ### Attributes Attribute | Type | Description --------------|---------|------------ alternatives | array | Alternatives for choice question end-with | integer | Range end multiple | boolean | Allow multiple answers or not for choice question question-type | string | Type of question start-with | integer | Range start title | string | Question title description | string | Question description. Useful if you want to give some more detail about the question. unit | string | Unit for range question single-line | boolean | Single line answer for text question

request.description:
## List stages

Use this endpoint to retrieve lists of stages.

### Example parameters

| Parameter | Default | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| include | null | Comma separated list of relations to include in the response. For example `job-applications`. |
| sort | id | Sort list by any of the stage attributes. **Note!** Use `row-order` to sort as in Teamtailor, but only when in the scope of a job. |
| filter\[job\] |  | Filter stages by job by using `filter[job]=123` |
| filter\[stage-type\] |  | Filter stages by stage-type by using `filter[stage-type]=123` |

## Show a stage

Use this endpoint to retrieve a specific stage.

### Example parameters

Parameter          | Default      | Description
------------------ | ------------ | -----------
include            | null         | Comma separated list of relations to include in the response. For example `job-applications`.

item.description:
# Stages

Required scope: Admin

A stage indicate the candidate status for a job-application. The stages are defined for each job. Each job has two default stages which can't be deleted or modified:

- Inbox with the _stage-type_ `inbox`
    
- Hired with the _stage-type_ `hired`
    

All other user created stages have _stage-type_ `screening | interview | offer`

### Attributes

| Attribute | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| created-at | date |  |
| updated-at | date |  |
| name | string |  |
| legacy-stage-type-name | string | _Legacy attribute_. Possible values: `Inbox`, `In process`, or `Hired` |
| row-order | integer | Value stages are manually sorted by in Teamtailor |
| active-job-applications-count | integer | Number of active applications in the stage |
| rejected-job-applications-count | integer | Number of rejected applications in the stage |

### Relations

| **Relation** | **Comment** |
| --- | --- |
| job-applications |  |
| job |  |
| triggers |  |
| stage-type | Use to get the type of stage: inbox, screening, interview, offer, hired |

request.description:
## Delete a User

Required scope: Admin

When a user is recruiter for a job, you can't delete the user without first assigning the jobs to a different user.  
To automatically assign all jobs to a different user, use the parameter `assign_jobs_to_user_id`.

## Create User

Required scope: Admin

A unique `email` is required.

An email invitation will be sent to the specified email if role is not `no-access` or SSO is activated. The user will be able to create a password using the link in the invitation email.

Use the `merge` attribute to merge the user attributes in case a user with a matching email address already exists.

response.name: Create user

item.description:
Handle user information.

### Attributes

| Attribute | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| description | string | About text, visible on the public profile |
| email | string | Visible on career site profile if `hide-email` is `false`. **Requires admin permission if hidden.** |
| external-id | string | Use to store your own ID to reference users by. Will also be used in SSO logins to look up users if sent as name-id. |
| facebook-profile | string | URL to Facebook profile |
| google-profile | string | URL to Google+ profile |
| hide-email | boolean | If e-mail address should be hidden on career site |
| instagram-profile | string | URL to Instagram profile |

| locale | string | Language of Teamtailor (`en`: English, `es`: Spanish, `fi`: Finnish, `fr`: French, `de`: German, `sv`: Swedish, `it`: Italian, `no`: Norwegian, `da`: Danish) |
| login-email | string | Account email used to login and for notifications (might be separate than email on career site profile). Can be null until user accepts invitation. **Requires admin permission** |
| merge | boolean | **Write only** True if the attributes should be merged with an existing user, matched by email address. |
| name | string | The user's name |
| other-profile | string | URL to other profile |
| phone | string | Phone number |
| picture | object | Url to user picture |
| role | string | Permission role (`no_access`, `user`, `designer`, `hiring_manager`, `recruiter`, `recruitment_admin`, `admin` or `external_recruiter`) |
| role-addons | array of strings | Role addons (`["designer"]`, `null)` |
| title | string | Title, e.g 'CEO' or 'Account manager' |
| time-format | string | Time format of teamtailor, `HH:mm` for 24 hours and `hh:mm A` for 12 hours |
| time-zone | string | City of desired time zone, e.g `Stockholm`, `London`, `Warsaw` |
| twitter-profile | string | URL to Twitter profile |
| username | string | Internal username, used in mentions |
| visible | boolean | If profile is visible on the career site |
| signature | string | Email signature |
| notification-candidate-message | boolean | Notify user when candidate replies to an email **Requires admin permission.** (DEPRECATED) |
| notification-job | boolean | Notify user when new job is published **Requires admin permission.** (DEPRECATED) |
| notification-connected-candidate | boolean | Notify user when a candidate connects with your company **Requires admin permission.** (DEPRECATED) |
| notification-mention | boolean | Notify user when a team member mentions them **Requires admin permission.** (DEPRECATED) |
| notification-lead-message | boolean | Notify user when a visitor writes a message **Requires admin permission.** (DEPRECATED) |
| notification-hiring-team-application | boolean | Notify user when a candidate applies for a job where they're part of the hiring team **Requires admin permission.** (DEPRECATED) |
| notification-daily-digest | boolean | Receive a daily digest email with all activities in the hiring teams **Requires admin permission.** (DEPRECATED) |
| notification-recruiter-application | boolean | Notify user when a candidate applies for a job where they are a recruiter **Requires admin permission.** (DEPRECATED) |
| notification-removal-request | boolean | Notify user when a candidate asked to be removed (for GDPR managers only) **Requires admin permission.** (DEPRECATED) |
| notification-gdpr-digest | boolean | Sends daily digest of GDPR/data retention activities (for GDPR managers only) **Requires admin permission.** (DEPRECATED) |

### Relations

| Relation | Description |
| --- | --- |
| team-memberships | Hiring teams the user is a part of |
| activities | User activity log |
| department | Listed under this department on the career site |
| location | Listed under this location on the career site |
| jobs | Jobs the user is recruiter for |
| notification-settings | Notification settings for the user (ADDED `X-API-VERSION: 20210218`) |

item.name: Transient Uploads

request.description:
Uploads a file to temporary storage and returns a _transient URI_ that can be used in place of a public URL in some endpoints. This is useful if you are not able to provide public URLs for us to retrieve files from.

The transient URI is a unique, tamper-proof token that allows us (and only us) to retrieve the uploaded file from temporary storage and attach it to another resource (like a Candidate). It is exposed only once in the response from this endpoint, so you must take care to store it until you are ready to use it. If you lose the transient URI for an uploaded file, you must upload the file again to get a new URI.

As the name implies, files uploaded to this endpoint are not stored permanently. You are expected to use the URI immediately to attach the uploaded file to another resource.

**Note:** Unlike other endpoints in our public API, this endpoint accepts form data requests, not JSON. The response is always JSON.

item.description: The _Transient Uploads_ API provides an endpoint for uploading a file to temporary storage for use in subsequent requests.

item.name: Notification settings

response.name: List notification settings
List notification settings - Old x-api-version

item.description:
# Notification settings

Available for versions 20210218 or newer.

Before api-version 20210218 we used to send notification settings through users now we handle notifications here, we also added a number of new keys and replaced the old ones for new keys more descriptive on what they do.

Use to customise notifications settings to be sent to the users. There are number of possible notifications that can be set. Here is the list of notifications keys that can be modified

Keys                                  | Old Keys (from users api-version 20161108)  | Description
--------------------------------------|-----------------------------------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------
new_job_published                     | notification_new_job                    | New job is published
candidate_connect                     | notification_new_open_resume            | Candidate connects with your company
candidate_replies                     | notification_new_message                | Candidate replies to your message
candidate_replies_to_hiring_team      | N/A                        | Candidate replies to a message
candidate_schedule_meeting            | N/A                        | Candidate picks time for a meeting
team_member_mention                   | notification_new_mention                | Team member mentions you
unread_notifications_digest           | notification_new_mention                | Unread notifications digest
new_message_from_lead                 | notification_lead                       | New messages from leads
requisition_approvals                 | notification_requisition_approval       | New requisition request
requisition_reminders                 | notification_requisition_reminder       | Requisition awaiting your approval
hiring_team_candidate_applies_for_job | notification_new_resume_as_hiring_team  | Candidate applies for a job
daily_digest_email                    | notification_daily_digest               | Daily digest with all activity for a job
candidate_partner_result              | notification_new_partner_result         | Candidate gets a new result from a partner
recruiter_candidate_applies_for_job   | notification_new_resume_as_recruiter    | Candidate applies for a job
gdpr_removal_request                  | notification_removal_request            | Removal request realtime notification
gdpr_digest                           | notification_gdpr_digest                | GDPR activity daily digest
candidate_answered_questionnaire      | N/A                         | Candidate answered questionnaire

**IMPORTANT:** *OLD keys are for reference only for companies migrating from api-version 20161108 if you are developing a new solution pay no attention to them*

Each of these notifications key can have email, browser or mobile setting. All of them are guaranteed to have an email setting but not necessarily browser or mobile

### Attributes

Attribute                               | Type    | Description
----------------------------------------|---------|---------------------------
notification_key                        | string  | Notification to be modified
email                                   | boolean | Email notification status
browser                                 | boolean | Browser notification status
mobile                                  | boolean | mobile notification status

### Relations

Relation   | Description
-----------|------------
user      | user notification setting
